availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Holladay (Carlisle, Nicholas Co, KY, attorney)

body.p: Carlisle, Nicholas County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Mary M. Holladay. Attorney in Nicholas County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Nicholas County in 1850. Attorney in Nicholas County in 1860. Circuit court clerk in Nicholas County in 1860. Attorney in Nicholas County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 2, p. 391A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 2, p. 1 of microfilm.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, County, City/District, p. 368.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, Carlisle, p. 277B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 7th Congressional District, Vol. 2, July 1863, p. 187 (Accessed via ancestry.com on March 17, 2020).
_ Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989_, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Nicholas County Administrator Bonds, 1854-1969, p. 787 of microfilm (Accessed through ancestry.com on March 17, 2020).
